a.g: It guides to the right course, and we have believed in it. And we will never associate with our Lord anyone.
And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son
And that our foolish one has been saying about Allah an excessive transgression.
And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about Allah a lie.
And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden.
And they had thought, as you thought, that Allah would never send anyone [as a messenger].
And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.
And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing, but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.
And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intends for them a right course.
And among us are the righteous, and among us are [others] not so; we were [of] divided ways.
And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to Allah upon earth, nor can we escape Him by flight.
And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Foundations of Belief
If you say: What is the doubt of the Mu'tazila and the Murji'a and what is the proof of the invalidity of their statement? I say: Their doubt is generalities of the Quran. As for the Murji'a, they said: The believer does not enter the Fire even if he commits all sins, due to His saying, the Mighty and Majestic: 'So whoever believes in his Lord, he does not fear loss (bakhsan) nor oppression (rahqan).' And due to His saying, the Blessed and Exalted: 'And those who believe in Allah and His messengers - those are the truthful ones.' The verse. And due to His saying: 'Every time a group is thrown into it, its keepers will ask them...' until His saying: 'So we denied and said: Allah has not sent down anything.' So His saying 'Every time a group is thrown into it' is general, so it should be that whoever is thrown into the Fire is a denier. And due to His saying: 'None will burn in it except the most wretched, who denied and turned away.' And this is restriction, affirmation, and negation. And due to His saying: 'Whoever comes with a good deed will have better than it, and they will be safe from fear that Day.' So faith (Iman) is the head of good deeds. And due to His saying: 'And Allah loves the doers of good (Muhsinin).' And He said: 'Indeed, We do not waste the reward of one who does good work.' And they have no proof in that, for wherever faith (Iman) is mentioned in these verses, it is intended to be faith (Iman) with action, since we have clarified that faith (Iman) may be used and intended to mean Islam, which is agreement with the heart (Qalb), speech, and action. The evidence for this interpretation is many reports about punishing the disobedient and the measures of punishment, and his saying (peace be upon him): 'He will be taken out of the Fire whoever has in his heart (Qalb) an atom's weight of faith (Iman).' So how can he be taken out if he did not enter? And from the Quran, His saying: 'Indeed, Allah does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills.' And the exception with will indicates division.

a.g: And among us are Muslims [in submission to Allah], and among us are the unjust. And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.
But as for the unjust, they will be, for Hell, firewood.'
And [Allah revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way, We would have given them abundant provision
So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord He will put into arduous punishment.
And [He revealed] that the masjids are for Allah, so do not invoke with Allah anyone.
And that when the Servant of Allah stood up supplicating Him, they almost became about him a compacted mass."
Say, [O Muhammad], "I only invoke my Lord and do not associate with Him anyone."
Say, "Indeed, I do not possess for you [the power of] harm or right direction."
Say, "Indeed, there will never protect me from Allah anyone [if I should disobey], nor will I find in other than Him a refuge.
But [I have for you] only notification from Allah, and His messages." And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, for him is the fire of Hell; they will abide therein forever.

Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol 4: Meditation
And what is hidden from the sights is expressed as the Unseen (Al-Ghayb) and the Dominion (Al-Malakut), and Allah the Exalted is the Knower of the Unseen (Al-Ghayb) and the Witnessed (Al-Shahadah), and the Compeller of the Kingdom (Al-Mulk) and the Dominion (Al-Malakut). And no one encompasses anything of His knowledge except by what He wills, and He is the Knower of the Unseen (Al-Ghayb), so He does not reveal His Unseen (Ghayb) to anyone except to a messenger whom He has approved. Therefore, O intelligent one, contemplate in the Dominion (Al-Malakut), so perhaps the doors of the heaven will be opened for you, and you will wander with your Heart (Qalb) in its regions until your Heart (Qalb) stands before the Throne of the Most Merciful.
